is a Competency Center?\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Competency Centers (CCs) are a way to collect, share and grow our competencies that drive the delivery of our services to EPAM customers. Competency centers are run globally as part of the CTO Office and all report to Eli Feldman.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"From one side, the competency centers are there to aggregate information about their competency from the entire organization (e.g. what trainings are necessary? What challenges are colleagues facing?). For this purpose, many competency centers are working together with local representatives who contribute to the competency center on a voluntary basis.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Another goal of the competency centers is to spread the knowledge and support delivery in their respective competencies (e.g. practices like Business Analysis, or industry areas like Travel). This support includes but is not limited to be involved in pre-sales activities, help with competency assessment, provide hands-on help in delivery projects, build training curricula, provide webinars and run workshops. Because the competency centers are running on a low budget, they run on a pull basis, servicing requests as they come up. All CCs service desk emails are listed on
